alert.note: Alert for Central Piscataquis (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued December 09 at 11:40AM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...Heavy Rain and Snowmelt Flooding Sunday night into Monday night... A strong low pressure system will bring heavy rainfall to northern and eastern Maine. Rainfall of 1 to 3 inches with some locally higher amounts is expected. The rainfall will combine with snowmelt and a partially frozen ground to cause small stream, creek and river flooding. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of Central Highlands Maine, including the following areas, Central Piscataquis and Southern Piscataquis. * WHEN...From late Sunday night through Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. The Piscataquis River may reach minor flood stage with a rapid response to snowmelt plus rainfall in complex terrain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Heavy rainfall and warm temperatures will melt most, if not all, existing snowpack. The heavy rainfall, snowmelt, and high rainfall rates over a partially frozen ground will create a scenario promoting small stream, creek and river flooding. - For flood safety tips visit, http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
